name: Web Application Pentesting Workflow
summary: Comprehensive methodology for web application security testing from reconnaissance to reporting, covering OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities and modern attack techniques.
details: This workflow provides a systematic approach to web application penetration testing. It follows industry-standard methodologies including OWASP Testing Guide and PTES, ensuring thorough coverage of all attack vectors. The workflow is divided into distinct phases with clear decision points and evidence collection requirements.

steps.detail: Install base reconnaissance tools: amass, sublist3r, theHarvester, dnsrecon
Set up web scanning tools: nmap, nikto, gobuster, ffuf, nuclei
Configure web proxies: burpsuite or owasp-zap
Prepare exploitation tools: sqlmap, metasploit, searchsploit

notes: Start with passive reconnaissance to avoid detection
Identifies technologies, frameworks, and potential vulnerabilities

steps.title: Subdomain Enumeration
steps.details: Discover all subdomains and attack surface using multiple tools
steps.command: amass enum -d example.com -o amass_results.txt && sublist3r -d example.com -o sublist3r_results.txt

steps.title: OSINT Gathering
steps.details: Collect publicly available information about the target
steps.command: theHarvester -d example.com -l 500 -b google,linkedin -h

steps.title: DNS Reconnaissance
steps.details: Map DNS infrastructure and identify potential entry points
steps.command: dnsrecon -d example.com -t std -o dns_results.txt

steps.title: Technology Identification
steps.details: Identify web technologies, frameworks, and versions
steps.command: whatweb --log-verbose=tech_ident.txt https://target.example.com

steps.title: Port Scanning
steps.details: Identify open ports and services on target infrastructure
steps.command: nmap -sS -sV -oN nmap_scan.txt -p- target.example.com

steps.title: Web Vulnerability Scanning
steps.details: Automated scanning for common web vulnerabilities
steps.command: nikto -h https://target.example.com -o nikko_results.txt

steps.title: Directory Brute Forcing
steps.details: Discover hidden directories and files
steps.command: gobuster dir -u https://target.example.com -w /usr/share/wordlists/dirbuster/directory-list-2.3-medium.txt -o gobuster_results.txt

steps.title: Nuclei Template Scanning
steps.details: Template-based vulnerability scanning
steps.command: nuclei -l targets.txt -o nuclei_results.txt

steps.title: Web Proxy Configuration
steps.details: Set up Burp Suite or OWASP ZAP for intercepting traffic
steps.command: # Configure browser proxy to 127.0.0.1:8080 for Burp Suite

steps.title: SQL Injection Testing
steps.details: Test for SQL injection vulnerabilities using sqlmap
steps.command: sqlmap -u "https://target.example.com/page?id=1" --batch --sql-shell

steps.title: XSS Testing
steps.details: Test for reflected and stored XSS vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Use Burp Suite scanner and manual testing with XSS payloads

steps.title: Authentication Bypass
steps.details: Test authentication mechanisms for bypasses
steps.command: # Test default credentials, SQL injection in login forms, JWT manipulation

steps.title: Exploit Research
steps.details: Find exploits for identified vulnerabilities
steps.command: searchsploit apache 2.4.49

steps.title: Metasploit Exploitation
steps.details: Use Metasploit framework for exploitation
steps.command: msfconsole -x "use exploit/multi/http/apache_mod_cgi_bash_env_exec; set RHOSTS target.example.com; exploit"

steps.title: Shell Stabilization
steps.details: Upgrade basic shell to fully interactive session
steps.command: # Use pwncat or python -c 'import pty; pty.spawn("/bin/bash")'

steps.title: Privilege Escalation
steps.details: Escalate privileges within the compromised system
steps.command: linpeas.sh | tee linpeas_results.txt

steps.title: Evidence Documentation
steps.details: Collect and organize all evidence and screenshots
steps.command: # Create evidence folder structure: mkdir -p evidence/{recon,scan,exploit,report}

steps.title: Vulnerability Documentation
steps.details: Document each finding with screenshots and proof
steps.command: # Use Dradis or Faraday for collaborative reporting

steps.title: Risk Assessment
steps.details: Assess risk levels and business impact
steps.command: # Use CVSS calculator for scoring vulnerabilities

steps.title: Final Report Generation
steps.details: Generate comprehensive penetration testing report
steps.command: # Compile findings, recommendations, and remediation steps

stages.label: Day 1: Reconnaissance
stages.description: Passive and active reconnaissance, subdomain enumeration, technology identification
stages.command: amass enum -d example.com -o amass_results.txt && sublist3r -d example.com -o sublist3r.txt

stages.label: Day 2: Scanning
stages.description: Port scanning, vulnerability scanning, directory enumeration
stages.command: nmap -sS -sV -oN nmap_scan.txt target.example.com && nikto -h https://target.example.com -o nikko.txt

stages.label: Day 3: Manual Testing
stages.description: Configure web proxy, test for OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities
stages.command: # Start Burp Suite, configure browser proxy, begin manual testing

stages.label: Day 4: Exploitation
stages.description: Exploit validated vulnerabilities, establish persistence
stages.command: msfconsole -r exploit.rc

stages.label: Day 5: Reporting
stages.description: Document findings, generate report, provide remediation
stages.command: # Compile evidence, write executive summary, create technical report

output_notes.meaning: Administrative interface potentially exposed
Web server running vulnerable Apache version
Database can be accessed and potentially dumped
Sensitive files may be exposed
Accounts can be bypassed or brute-forced

advanced_usage.title: Custom Nuclei Templates
advanced_usage.scenario: Create custom templates for target-specific vulnerabilities
notes: Write YAML templates for application-specific vulnerabilities

advanced_usage.title: Burp Suite Intruder Automation
advanced_usage.scenario: Automate parameter fuzzing with custom payloads
advanced_usage.command: # Use Intruder with custom wordlists and payload markers
notes: Create targeted payload lists for specific parameter types

advanced_usage.title: Metasploit Resource Scripts
advanced_usage.scenario: Automate exploitation chain with resource scripts
notes: Resource scripts can chain multiple exploits automatically

resources.label: OWASP Testing Guide
resources.description: Comprehensive web application testing methodology

resources.label: PTES Framework
resources.description: Penetration Testing Execution Standard

resources.label: Burp Suite Documentation
resources.description: Complete guide to Burp Suite features and techniques

name: Infrastructure Pentesting Workflow
summary: Systematic methodology for infrastructure penetration testing covering network reconnaissance, service enumeration, vulnerability assessment, and system compromise.
details: This workflow provides a structured approach to testing network infrastructure including servers, network devices, and cloud environments. It follows industry best practices for infrastructure security testing with emphasis on stealth, thoroughness, and proper evidence collection.

steps.detail: Install network scanning tools: nmap, masscan, naabu
Set up enumeration tools: enum4linux, smbmap, snmpwalk
Prepare exploitation framework: metasploit, searchsploit
Configure post-exploitation tools: mimikatz, bloodhound-python

notes: Quick discovery of all open ports
Detailed service version and script scanning

steps.title: Port Discovery
steps.details: Identify all open ports using fast scanning techniques
steps.command: masscan -p1-65535 target.example.com --rate=1000 -o masscan_results.txt

steps.title: Service Version Detection
steps.details: Identify running services and their versions
steps.command: nmap -sV -oN service_versions.txt -p $(cat masscan_results.txt | grep -oP '\d+ | tr '\n' ',' | sed 's/,$//') target.example.com

steps.title: OS Detection
steps.details: Identify operating systems of target hosts
steps.command: nmap -O -oN os_detection.txt target.example.com

steps.title: Network Topology Mapping
steps.details: Map network structure and relationships
steps.command: nmap -sL -oN network_map.txt target.example.com/24

steps.title: SMB Enumeration
steps.details: Enumerate SMB shares and permissions
steps.command: enum4linux -a target.example.com > enum4linux_results.txt

steps.title: SNMP Enumeration
steps.details: Gather information via SNMP community strings
steps.command: snmpwalk -c public -v1 target.example.com > snmpwalk_results.txt

steps.title: SMTP Enumeration
steps.details: Enumerate SMTP users and configuration
steps.command: smtp-user-enum -M VRFY -U users.txt -t target.example.com

steps.title: DNS Zone Transfer
steps.details: Attempt DNS zone transfer for domain enumeration
steps.command: dig axfr @ns1.example.com example.com > zone_transfer.txt

steps.title: Nmap Script Scanning
steps.details: Run comprehensive NSE scripts for vulnerability detection
steps.command: nmap -sC --script vuln -oN vuln_scan.txt target.example.com

steps.title: Nuclei Scanning
steps.details: Template-based vulnerability scanning
steps.command: nuclei -target target.example.com -o nuclei_results.txt

steps.title: Service-Specific Testing
steps.details: Test specific services for known vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Test web servers, databases, and other services individually

steps.title: Configuration Review
steps.details: Review service configurations for security issues
steps.command: # Analyze service banners, default credentials, misconfigurations

steps.title: Exploit Research
steps.details: Research exploits for identified vulnerabilities
steps.command: searchsploit service_name version_number

steps.title: Metasploit Exploitation
steps.details: Use Metasploit for automated exploitation
steps.command: msfconsole -x "use exploit/multi/samba/usermap_script; set RHOSTS target.example.com; exploit"

steps.title: Manual Exploitation
steps.details: Manually exploit vulnerabilities when automated tools fail
steps.command: # Use custom payloads and manual techniques

steps.title: Privilege Escalation
steps.details: Escalate privileges on compromised systems
steps.command: linpeas.sh | tee priv_esc_results.txt

steps.title: Persistence Mechanisms
steps.details: Establish persistent access to compromised systems
steps.command: # Create backdoors, scheduled tasks, or services

steps.title: Lateral Movement
steps.details: Move laterally through the network
steps.command: # Use stolen credentials, pass-the-hash, or other techniques

steps.title: Data Exfiltration
steps.details: Extract sensitive data from compromised systems
steps.command: # Collect and exfiltrate valuable data

steps.title: Covering Tracks
steps.details: Clean up evidence of intrusion
steps.command: # Clear logs, remove tools, hide backdoors

stages.label: Day 1: Network Mapping
stages.description: Complete network reconnaissance and service identification
stages.command: masscan -p1-65535 target.example.com --rate=1000 -o masscan.txt && nmap -sV -oN services.txt target.example.com

stages.label: Day 2: Service Enumeration
stages.description: Deep dive into discovered services and configurations
stages.command: enum4linux -a target.example.com && snmpwalk -c public -v1 target.example.com

stages.label: Day 3: Vulnerability Testing
stages.description: Comprehensive vulnerability assessment and exploitation
stages.command: nmap -sC --script vuln target.example.com && nuclei -target target.example.com

stages.label: Day 4: System Compromise
stages.description: Exploit vulnerabilities and establish access
stages.command: msfconsole -r exploit.rc

stages.label: Day 5: Post-Exploitation
stages.description: Lateral movement, data collection, and persistence
stages.command: # Establish persistence, move laterally, collect data

output_notes.indicator: Open SMB shares with write permissions
output_notes.meaning: Potential for remote code execution and data exfiltration
Extensive network information disclosure
Known vulnerabilities likely exploitable
Brute force or credential stuffing possible
Potential for unauthorized access

advanced_usage.title: Custom Nmap Scripts
advanced_usage.scenario: Create custom NSE scripts for target-specific testing
notes: Write Lua scripts for custom vulnerability detection

advanced_usage.title: Metasploit Automation
advanced_usage.scenario: Automate large-scale exploitation with resource scripts
notes: Resource scripts can handle multiple targets automatically

advanced_usage.title: Custom Exploit Development
advanced_usage.scenario: Develop custom exploits for 0-day vulnerabilities
advanced_usage.command: # Use Python, Metasploit, or custom C/C++ exploits
notes: Custom exploits when public ones are not available

resources.label: Network Security Assessment
resources.description: Comprehensive guide to network security testing

resources.label: Metasploit Unleashed
resources.description: Free Metasploit training course

name: Wireless Security Audit Workflow
summary: Complete methodology for wireless security testing covering WiFi networks, Bluetooth devices, and RF spectrum analysis.
details: This workflow provides a systematic approach to wireless security testing including WiFi network auditing, rogue access point detection, and RF spectrum analysis. It covers both infrastructure and client-side attacks with emphasis on stealth and proper evidence collection.

installation_guides.summary: Configure wireless adapter for monitor mode

steps.detail: iwconfig # Identify wireless interface
sudo airmon-ng start wlan0 # Enable monitor mode
sudo iwconfig # Verify monitor mode is active
airodump-ng wlan0mon # Test packet capture
sudo apt install -y aircrack-ng kismet wifite reaver bully
sudo apt install -y mdk4 wireshark tshark
pip install scapy # For packet crafting

notes: Discover all nearby WiFi networks
Test WPS vulnerability for PIN recovery

steps.title: Monitor Mode Setup
steps.details: Configure wireless adapter for monitor mode
steps.command: sudo airmon-ng start wlan0 && sudo iwconfig

steps.title: Network Scanning
steps.details: Discover all wireless networks in range
steps.command: airodump-ng wlan0mon --write wireless_scan

steps.title: Channel Analysis
steps.details: Analyze channel usage and interference
steps.command: airodump-ng wlan0mon --write channel_analysis -c 1-14

steps.title: Signal Strength Mapping
steps.details: Map signal strength and coverage areas
steps.command: # Move around area while scanning to map coverage

steps.title: Target Network Selection
steps.details: Select target network for detailed analysis
steps.command: airodump-ng -c 6 --bssid AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF -w target wlan0mon

steps.title: Client Identification
steps.details: Identify connected clients and devices
steps.command: # Monitor connected clients in airodump-ng output

steps.title: Encryption Analysis
steps.details: Analyze encryption type and security configuration
steps.command: # Review WPA/WPA2/WPA3 and WPS configuration

steps.title: Traffic Capture
steps.details: Capture packets for offline analysis
steps.command: airodump-ng -w capture --bssid AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF wlan0mon

steps.title: WPS Testing
steps.details: Test WPS for PIN recovery vulnerabilities
steps.command: reaver -i wlan0mon -b AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF -vv -o wps_results.txt

steps.title: Deauthentication Attack
steps.details: Test network stability and client behavior
steps.command: aireplay-ng -0 5 -a AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF wlan0mon

steps.title: Evil Twin Testing
steps.details: Test for rogue access point susceptibility
steps.command: # Create fake AP with same SSID using airbase-ng

steps.title: Karma Attack Testing
steps.details: Test for automatic connection vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Use airbase-ng with karma mode for testing

steps.title: Handshake Capture
steps.details: Capture WPA/WPA2 handshake for cracking
steps.command: aireplay-ng -0 10 -a AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF -c 11:22:33:44:55:66 wlan0mon

steps.title: Dictionary Attack
steps.details: Attempt password cracking with wordlists
steps.command: aircrack-ng -w /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt capture-01.cap

steps.title: Brute Force Attack
steps.details: Brute force WPA/WPA2 passwords
steps.command: # Use hashcat or john the ripper for GPU acceleration

steps.title: PMKID Attack
steps.details: Attack WPA2 without clients using PMKID
steps.command: # Capture PMKID and crack with hashcat

steps.title: Packet Injection Testing
steps.details: Test for packet injection vulnerabilities
steps.command: aireplay-ng -3 -b AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF wlan0mon

steps.title: Client-Side Attacks
steps.details: Test connected clients for vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Use various client-side attack techniques

steps.title: RF Spectrum Analysis
steps.details: Analyze RF spectrum for interference and anomalies
steps.command: kismet -c kismet.conf -o spectrum_analysis

steps.title: Bluetooth Testing
steps.details: Test Bluetooth devices for security issues
steps.command: # Use btscanner and other Bluetooth tools

stages.label: Day 1: Discovery & Reconnaissance
stages.description: Complete wireless network discovery and initial analysis
stages.command: airmon-ng start wlan0 && airodump-ng wlan0mon --write day1_scan

stages.label: Day 2: Target Analysis
stages.description: Detailed analysis of target networks and clients
stages.command: airodump-ng -c 6 --bssid AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF -w target_analysis wlan0mon

stages.label: Day 3: Vulnerability Testing
stages.description: Test WPS, encryption, and configuration vulnerabilities
stages.command: reaver -i wlan0mon -b AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF -vv && aireplay-ng -0 5 -a AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF wlan0mon

stages.label: Day 4: Password Cracking
stages.description: Capture handshakes and attempt password recovery
stages.command: aireplay-ng -0 10 -a AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF wlan0mon && aircrack-ng -w rockyou.txt capture.cap

stages.label: Day 5: Advanced Testing
stages.description: RF analysis, Bluetooth testing, and report generation
stages.command: kismet -o rf_analysis && # Compile findings into report

output_notes.indicator: WPS PIN vulnerable to brute force
output_notes.meaning: Network can be compromised regardless of password strength
Network can be compromised in minutes
Dictionary attack likely successful
No authentication required for access
Potential evil twin attack in progress

advanced_usage.scenario: Use SDR tools for advanced RF spectrum analysis
notes: Requires HackRF or other SDR hardware

advanced_usage.title: Automated WiFi Auditing
advanced_usage.scenario: Automate comprehensive WiFi security testing
notes: Automated tool for complete WiFi security testing

advanced_usage.title: Bluetooth Low Energy Testing
advanced_usage.scenario: Test BLE devices for security vulnerabilities
advanced_usage.command: # Use gattacker and other BLE-specific tools
notes: Specialized testing for IoT and BLE devices

resources.description: Complete list of wireless security tools in Kali

resources.description: Comprehensive guide to WiFi security testing

steps.details: Identify cloud assets, accounts, and attack surface
steps.command: # Use cloud provider consoles and enumeration tools

steps.details: Review permissions, roles, and access patterns
steps.command: # Prowler, ScoutSuite for automated IAM analysis

steps.title: Misconfiguration Assessment
steps.details: Check for common security misconfigurations

steps.details: Check compliance with standards and regulations

steps.details: Prioritize findings and create remediation plan

Excessive permissions granted to identities
Data not encrypted at rest or in transit
Insufficient audit trail for security events

notes: AWS Lambda functions for auto-remediation
Azure Functions for automated responses
Cloud Functions for GCP automation

name: Internal Network Penetration Testing with AD Focus
summary: Structured PTES-compliant workflow for internal corporate networks with Active Directory, covering recon through reporting.
details: Use this workflow when performing internal penetration tests where credentials or LAN access are provided. It aligns to PTES phases and emphasizes stealth, lateral movement, and privilege escalation in AD environments.

steps.detail: Install enum4linux, CrackMapExec, BloodHound, and Impacket
Deploy password spraying lists (Seclists) and configure Kerbrute
Prepare reporting workspace (Dradis/Faraday/PT Journal templates)

steps.title: Network sweep
steps.details: Identify live hosts and critical services.

steps.title: AD data gathering
steps.details: Pull domain info without creds.
steps.command: crackmapexec smb 10.0.0.0/24 --shares

steps.title: BloodHound data
steps.details: Collect LDAP data for pathing.
steps.command: bloodhound-python -d corp.local -u svc -p Pass123 -gc dc1.corp.local -c All

steps.title: Password spraying
steps.details: Use safe lists and lockout thresholds.
steps.command: kerbrute passwordspray --dc dc1.corp.local -d corp.local users.txt Winter2024!

steps.title: Kerberoasting
steps.details: Request SPN tickets for cracking.
steps.command: GetUserSPNs.py corp.local/user:pass -request

steps.title: Local loot
steps.details: Dump creds via LSASS when allowed.
steps.command: impacket-secretsdump corp.local/user@host

steps.title: Token reuse
steps.details: Leverage admin sessions for PSExec/WinRM.
steps.command: crackmapexec winrm targets.txt -H hash

steps.title: Path of attack
steps.details: Use BloodHound queries for privesc.
steps.command: MATCH p=shortestPath((u:User {name:'USER'}),(g:Group {name:'DOMAIN ADMINS'})) RETURN p

steps.title: Persistence
steps.details: Document scheduled tasks/backdoors if in scope.
steps.command: PowerView Add-ObjectAcl

stages.label: Day 1
stages.description: Recon + host discovery.

stages.label: Day 2
stages.description: Credential harvesting and spraying.
stages.command: kerbrute passwordspray ...

stages.label: Day 3
stages.description: Privilege escalation + lateral movement.
stages.command: bloodhound -c All

stages.label: Day 4
stages.description: Persistence testing + data access.
stages.command: rubeus asktgt

stages.label: Day 5
stages.description: Reporting + cleanup.
stages.command: # PT Journal reporting template

output_notes.meaning: AS-REP roast candidate.
Account protected by AdminSDHolder; requires caution.
Password spray detected—slow down or pause.

advanced_usage.title: Automated attack pathing
advanced_usage.scenario: Use preloaded datasets to compute attack paths quickly.
notes: Update queries per client scope

advanced_usage.title: Delegated credential theft
advanced_usage.scenario: Monitor for unconstrained delegation tickets.
notes: Log timeline for reporting

name: Wireless Security Assessment Workflow
summary: Methodology for WiFi/Bluetooth assessments covering scoping, discovery, exploitation, and reporting.
details: Use this workflow for wireless network and device engagements following PTES. It balances onsite logistics (survey, rogue AP detection) with lab-based cracking and reporting.

steps.detail: Two wireless cards capable of monitor/injection (ath9k/mt76)
aircrack-ng suite, Bettercap, Kismet
GPS logger + PT Journal templates for site survey

steps.title: Passive survey
steps.details: Map APs/clients.
steps.command: kismet -c wlan0mon

steps.title: GPS logging
steps.details: Record AP coordinates.
steps.command: wiglewifi wardrive

steps.title: Rogue detection
steps.details: Scan for unauthorized SSIDs.
steps.command: bettercap -caplet wifi.recon

steps.title: Handshake capture
steps.details: Collect WPA/WPA2 handshakes.
steps.command: airodump-ng -w corp wlan0mon

steps.title: Cracking
steps.details: Use GPU or hashcat service.
steps.command: hashcat -m 22000 corp.hc22000 rockyou.txt

steps.title: WPS tests
steps.details: Brute PINs when in scope.
steps.command: reaver -i wlan0mon -b AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF -vv

stages.label: Day 1
stages.description: Recon + spectrum logging.
stages.command: kismet

stages.label: Day 2
stages.description: Credential capture (handshakes/WPS).
stages.command: reaver / aireplay

stages.label: Day 3
stages.description: Client attacks & rogue AP testing.
stages.command: bettercap -caplet hstshijack

stages.label: Day 4
stages.description: Password cracking + Bluetooth tests.
stages.command: hashcat

stages.label: Day 5
stages.description: Reporting and remediation guidance.
stages.command: # PT Journal wireless template

output_notes.meaning: Device rate-limited; document and move on.
Captured WPA handshake for cracking.
Device vulnerable to rogue AP/Evil Twin.

advanced_usage.title: Automated wardriving
advanced_usage.scenario: Continuous capture while walking site.
notes: Sync logs to PT Journal evidence

advanced_usage.title: PMKID harvesting
advanced_usage.scenario: Capture PMKIDs without client interaction.
notes: Use hashcat -m 22000 for cracking

name: Physical Security & Malware Drop Assessment
summary: End-to-end workflow for badge testing, onsite intrusion, and controlled malware drops (USB/CD) aligned with PTES physical phase.
details: Use this when assessing physical controls and employee response. Includes pretext planning, onsite execution, payload tracking, and evidence handling.

steps.detail: Prepare cloned badges, lock tools, hidden cameras
Stage payload media with payload delivery tracking (Canarytokens)
Load PT Journal field template on mobile device

steps.title: Recon
steps.details: Collect building maps and shift changes.
steps.command: maltego workspace --export facilities

steps.title: Payload creation
steps.details: Generate benign malware demo.
steps.command: msfvenom -p windows/x64/messagebox TITLE='Drill' TEXT='Do not run unknown USBs' -f exe > reminder.exe

steps.title: Authorization
steps.details: Ensure ROE letters onsite.
steps.command: # Print authorization

steps.title: Entry attempt
steps.details: Tailgate or use cloned badge.
steps.command: # Document with bodycam

steps.title: Drop payload
steps.details: Leave USB with Canary token at strategic locations.
steps.command: python3 dropper.py --deploy

steps.title: Monitor alerts
steps.details: Review Canary token hits and SOC responses.
steps.command: curl https://canary/api/events

stages.label: Day 0
stages.description: Recon + logistics.
stages.command: # Prep badges

stages.label: Day 1
stages.description: Initial entry attempts.
stages.command: # Execute onsite

stages.label: Day 2
stages.description: Payload drop + monitoring.
stages.command: # Deploy USB

stages.label: Day 3
stages.description: Interviews + social engineering.
stages.command: # Conduct debrief

stages.label: Day 4

name: Incident Response & Forensics Workflow
summary: Comprehensive workflow for Incident Response & Forensics Workflow
details: This workflow guides you through the complete process of Incident Response & Forensics Workflow

steps.title: Establish IR Team
steps.details: Assemble incident response team and define roles
steps.command: # Identify team members and assign responsibilities

steps.title: Gather Intelligence
steps.details: Collect information about the incident from various sources
steps.command: # Review logs, alerts, and user reports

steps.title: Contain the Incident
steps.details: Implement immediate containment measures
steps.command: # Isolate affected systems and stop the attack

steps.title: Volatile Evidence
steps.details: Capture volatile data before it changes
steps.command: # Collect memory dumps, network connections, running processes

steps.title: Persistent Evidence
steps.details: Collect files, logs, and system configuration
steps.command: # Image drives and collect relevant files

steps.title: Chain of Custody
steps.details: Document evidence handling procedures
steps.command: # Maintain detailed evidence logs

steps.title: Timeline Reconstruction
steps.details: Reconstruct the sequence of events
steps.command: # Correlate logs and evidence to build timeline

steps.title: Malware Analysis
steps.details: Analyze any malicious code or artifacts
steps.command: # Reverse engineer malware in isolated environment

steps.title: Attack Vector Analysis
steps.details: Determine how the attack was initiated
steps.command: # Identify entry points and attack methods

steps.title: System Recovery
steps.details: Restore affected systems to clean state
steps.command: # Rebuild or clean compromised systems

steps.title: Vulnerability Mitigation
steps.details: Address root causes and vulnerabilities
steps.command: # Apply patches and security fixes

steps.title: Monitoring Enhancement
steps.details: Improve detection and monitoring capabilities
steps.command: # Implement additional security controls

steps.title: Incident Report
steps.details: Document the complete incident response process
steps.command: # Create detailed incident report

steps.title: Lessons Learned
steps.details: Identify improvements for future incidents
steps.command: # Conduct post-incident review and update procedures

steps.title: Legal/Regulatory Compliance
steps.details: Ensure compliance with reporting requirements
steps.command: # File required reports and notifications

stages.label: Day 1: Preparation & Scoping
stages.description: Set up IR environment, define scope, and prepare tools
stages.command: # Prepare IR toolkit and evidence collection procedures

stages.label: Day 2: Evidence Collection
stages.description: Collect volatile and non-volatile evidence from affected systems
stages.command: # Execute evidence collection using FTK Imager or similar

stages.label: Day 3: Timeline Analysis
stages.description: Analyze system timelines and correlate events
stages.command: # Use log2timeline and timeline analysis tools

stages.label: Day 4: Artifact Analysis
stages.description: Examine malware, logs, and system artifacts
stages.command: # Perform forensic analysis of collected evidence

stages.label: Day 5: Reporting & Lessons Learned
stages.description: Document findings and provide remediation recommendations
stages.command: # Generate incident report and conduct debrief

name: PCI-DSS Compliance Assessment

steps.title: Define Assessment Scope
steps.details: Identify cardholder data environment and systems in scope
steps.command: # Map CDE boundaries and data flows

steps.title: Review Requirements
steps.details: Understand applicable PCI DSS requirements and testing procedures

steps.title: Maintain Vulnerability Program (Req 5-6)
steps.details: Review antivirus and security patch management
steps.command: # Assess malware protection and patch management

steps.title: Restrict Access (Req 7-8)
steps.details: Test access control mechanisms and user authentication
steps.command: # Review access controls and authentication methods

steps.title: Monitor & Test Networks (Req 10-11)
steps.details: Assess logging and intrusion detection capabilities
steps.command: # Test logging mechanisms and IDS/IPS systems

steps.title: Maintain Security Policy (Req 12)
steps.details: Review information security policy and procedures
steps.command: # Evaluate security policies and procedures

steps.title: External Vulnerability Scans
steps.details: Conduct external network vulnerability scanning
steps.command: # Perform quarterly external vulnerability scans

steps.title: Internal Vulnerability Scans
steps.details: Conduct internal network vulnerability scanning
steps.command: # Perform quarterly internal vulnerability scans

steps.title: Penetration Testing
steps.details: Execute penetration testing of CDE systems
steps.command: # Conduct annual penetration testing

steps.title: Address Findings

steps.command: # Implement corrective actions for findings

steps.title: Retest Controls
steps.details: Validate that remediation efforts are effective
steps.command: # Retest remediated controls and vulnerabilities

steps.title: Document Evidence

steps.command: # Collect and organize compliance evidence

steps.title: Compile Assessment Report
steps.details: Document all findings, remediation, and compliance status
steps.command: # Generate comprehensive PCI DSS assessment report

steps.title: Attestation of Compliance

steps.title: Continuous Compliance
steps.details: Establish processes for maintaining ongoing compliance
steps.command: # Implement continuous monitoring and compliance processes

name: Cloud IAM Assessment Workflow
summary: Vendor-neutral methodology for assessing cloud Identity and Access Management configurations across AWS, Azure, and GCP environments.
details: This workflow provides a systematic approach to cloud IAM security assessment, covering enumeration, privilege analysis, misconfiguration detection, and remediation guidance. It follows cloud security best practices and focuses on common attack vectors like privilege escalation and resource exposure.

installation_guides.summary: Required tools and access for cloud IAM assessment

steps.detail: Install cloud CLIs: awscli, azcli, gcloud
Configure authentication for target cloud environments
Install analysis tools: ScoutSuite, Prowler, or custom scripts
Set up secure credential management (aws-vault, Azure Key Vault, etc.)

notes: Comprehensive IAM configuration export
Requires iam:GetAccountAuthorizationDetails permission
Maps all role assignments across scopes
Use --query for filtering high-privilege roles
Exports project IAM bindings
Focus on roles/owner and roles/editor assignments

steps.title: Configure cloud CLI tools
steps.details: Set up authentication and verify access to target environments
steps.command: aws configure && az login && gcloud init

steps.title: Validate permissions
steps.details: Test basic read permissions before full enumeration
steps.command: aws sts get-caller-identity && az account show && gcloud auth list

steps.title: Document assessment scope
steps.details: Record target accounts, projects, and subscriptions
steps.command: aws organizations list-accounts && az account list && gcloud projects list

steps.title: Enumerate users and service accounts
steps.details: Discover all identities in the environment
steps.command: aws iam list-users && az ad user list && gcloud iam service-accounts list

steps.title: Map role and permission assignments
steps.details: Identify what permissions are assigned to which identities
steps.command: aws iam get-account-authorization-details && az role assignment list --all && gcloud projects get-iam-policy PROJECT_ID

steps.title: Discover trust relationships
steps.details: Find cross-account and cross-service trust configurations
steps.command: aws iam list-roles --query 'Roles[?AssumeRolePolicyDocument]' && az ad sp list && gcloud iam service-accounts list --filter='email~@PROJECT_ID.iam.gserviceaccount.com'

steps.title: Identify privilege escalation vectors
steps.details: Look for permissions that enable privilege escalation
steps.command: grep -i 'iam:\*\|sts:AssumeRole\|iam:PassRole' iam-dump.json

steps.title: Test role assumption capabilities
steps.details: Attempt to assume discovered roles (safely)
steps.command: aws sts assume-role --role-arn arn:aws:iam::ACCOUNT:role/ROLE --role-session-name test

steps.title: Analyze service account keys
steps.details: Check for exposed or overly privileged service account keys
steps.command: gcloud iam service-accounts keys list --iam-account SERVICE_ACCOUNT

steps.title: Enumerate storage resources
steps.details: Find buckets, containers, and storage accounts
steps.command: aws s3 ls && az storage account list && gsutil ls

steps.title: Check storage permissions
steps.details: Identify publicly accessible or misconfigured storage
steps.command: aws s3api get-bucket-acl --bucket BUCKET && az storage blob list --account-name ACCOUNT --container CONTAINER && gsutil iam get gs://BUCKET

steps.title: Assess compute resource access
steps.details: Check VM and container permissions
steps.command: aws ec2 describe-instances && az vm list && gcloud compute instances list

steps.title: Document findings
steps.details: Record all identified misconfigurations and risks
steps.command: Create detailed report with evidence screenshots and commands

steps.title: Prioritize remediation actions
steps.details: Rank findings by risk level and impact
steps.command: Focus on critical privilege escalation paths first

steps.title: Provide remediation guidance
steps.details: Suggest specific configuration changes and best practices
steps.command: Reference CIS benchmarks and cloud provider security guides

stages.label: Identity Discovery
stages.description: Map all users, roles, and service accounts

stages.label: Permission Analysis
stages.description: Analyze assigned permissions and policies

stages.label: Trust Relationship Mapping
stages.description: Document cross-account and cross-service trusts

stages.label: Attack Path Identification
stages.description: Find chains of permissions enabling escalation

stages.label: Risk Prioritization
stages.description: Rank escalation paths by exploitability and impact

stages.label: Resource Enumeration
stages.description: Discover all storage buckets/containers

stages.label: Access Control Review
stages.description: Check permissions and public access settings

stages.label: Data Classification
stages.description: Assess sensitivity of stored data

stages.label: Misconfiguration Analysis
stages.description: Identify insecure configurations

stages.label: Impact Assessment
stages.description: Evaluate potential data exposure risks

output_notes.meaning: Insufficient permissions - may indicate proper security controls
Potentially dangerous public access to resources
Overly permissive permissions found
Privilege escalation vector identified

advanced_usage.title: Automated multi-cloud IAM assessment
advanced_usage.scenario: Comprehensive IAM scanning across AWS, Azure, and GCP
advanced_usage.command:
# Use ScoutSuite or Prowler for automated assessment
scoutsuite --provider aws --profile audit
scoutsuite --provider azure --user-account
scoutsuite --provider gcp --project PROJECT_ID
notes: Requires appropriate cloud access and tool installation
Generate HTML reports for detailed analysis
Focus on IAM-related findings in the reports

advanced_usage.title: Privilege escalation path analysis
advanced_usage.scenario: Graph and analyze potential privilege escalation chains
advanced_usage.command:
# Use custom scripts or BloodHound for cloud
python3 -c "
import boto3
iam = boto3.client('iam')
roles = iam.list_roles()
for role in roles['Roles']:
    print(f"Role: {role['RoleName']}")
    # Analyze trust policies and permissions
"
notes: Develop custom scripts for specific cloud environments
Use graph databases like Neo4j for complex relationship mapping
Consider using tools like Principal Mapper for AWS

advanced_usage.title: Storage misconfiguration hunting
advanced_usage.scenario: Systematic discovery of exposed cloud storage
advanced_usage.command:
# Use storage enumeration tools
python3 s3scanner.py --bucket-file buckets.txt
az storage account list --query '[].{Name:name, AllowBlobPublicAccess:allowBlobPublicAccess}'
gsutil ls -p PROJECT_ID
notes: Combine with public access testing
Document findings with screenshots and commands
Assess data sensitivity and business impact

name: Modern API Security Testing Workflow
summary: End-to-end methodology for testing modern APIs including REST, GraphQL, gRPC, WebSocket, and JWT-based authentication systems with OWASP API Top 10 2023 coverage.
details: This comprehensive workflow covers the complete lifecycle of modern API security testing, from initial discovery through exploitation and reporting. It addresses REST APIs, GraphQL endpoints, gRPC services, WebSocket connections, and JWT authentication mechanisms. The methodology follows OWASP API Top 10 2023 guidelines and includes specialized testing techniques for each API type.

installation_guides.summary: Essential tools for modern API testing

steps.detail: Install API discovery tools: ffuf, gobuster, dirsearch
Setup proxy tools with API support: burpsuite, owasp-zap
Install GraphQL tools: graphqlmap, inql, graphql-introspector
Setup gRPC tools: grpcurl, grpcui, protoc
Install WebSocket tools: wscat, websocat
Setup JWT tools: jwt-cracker, jwt.io, jwt-cli

notes: Discover REST API endpoints and GraphQL paths
Extract complete GraphQL schema via introspection
List all available gRPC services

steps.title: REST API Discovery
steps.details: Identify REST endpoints using directory enumeration and traffic analysis.
steps.command: ffuf -w api-paths.txt -u https://target.com/FUZZ -mc 200

steps.title: GraphQL Endpoint Discovery
steps.details: Find GraphQL endpoints through reconnaissance and common path testing.
steps.command: ffuf -w graphql-paths.txt -u https://target.com/FUZZ -mc 200

steps.title: OpenAPI/Swagger Enumeration
steps.details: Locate API documentation files for endpoint discovery.
steps.command: curl -s https://target.com/swagger.json | jq '.paths | keys[]'

steps.title: gRPC Service Discovery
steps.details: Discover gRPC endpoints and enumerate available services.
steps.command: grpcurl -plaintext target:50051 list

steps.title: WebSocket Discovery
steps.details: Identify WebSocket connections through JavaScript analysis and traffic monitoring.
steps.command: # Monitor for ws:// and wss:// patterns in JavaScript files

steps.title: JWT Token Analysis
steps.details: Capture and analyze JWT tokens for cryptographic weaknesses.
steps.command: # Extract tokens from Authorization headers and decode with jwt.io

steps.title: Algorithm Confusion Testing
steps.details: Test for alg=None attacks and algorithm swapping vulnerabilities.
steps.command: # Modify JWT header to use 'none' algorithm

steps.title: OAuth 2.0 Testing
steps.details: Test OAuth flows for redirect URI manipulation and scope abuse.
steps.command: # Test redirect_uri parameter and scope elevation

steps.title: API Key Testing
steps.details: Test API key validation and enumeration vulnerabilities.
steps.command: # Test with invalid keys, missing keys, and key enumeration

steps.title: Rate Limiting Analysis
steps.details: Test rate limiting mechanisms and bypass opportunities.
steps.command: # Send burst requests and test for rate limit bypasses

steps.title: GraphQL Introspection Testing
steps.details: Test for enabled introspection and extract complete schema.
steps.command: curl -X POST https://target.com/graphql -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"query":"{__schema{types{name}}}"}'

steps.title: Query Complexity Testing
steps.details: Test for DoS through complex nested queries and aliases.
steps.command: # Craft deeply nested queries with multiple aliases

steps.title: GraphQL BOLA Testing
steps.details: Test for broken object level authorization in GraphQL operations.
steps.command: # Manipulate object IDs in queries and mutations

steps.title: GraphQL Injection Testing
steps.details: Test for injection vulnerabilities in GraphQL arguments.
steps.command: # Test SQLi, XSS, and command injection in GraphQL parameters

steps.title: gRPC Reflection Testing
steps.details: Test for gRPC reflection service and extract service definitions.
steps.command: grpcurl -plaintext target:50051 describe

steps.title: Protocol Buffer Analysis
steps.details: Analyze Protocol Buffer definitions for security issues.
steps.command: # Review .proto files for sensitive fields and weak validation

steps.title: gRPC Authentication Testing
steps.details: Test gRPC authentication mechanisms and token validation.
steps.command: # Test with invalid/missing authentication tokens

steps.title: gRPC Authorization Testing
steps.details: Test authorization controls for different gRPC methods.
steps.command: # Test unauthorized access to privileged methods

steps.title: WebSocket Authentication Testing
steps.details: Test WebSocket authentication mechanisms and token validation.
steps.command: # Connect with invalid/missing auth tokens

steps.title: Message Injection Testing
steps.details: Test for injection vulnerabilities in WebSocket messages.
steps.command: # Send XSS, SQLi, and command injection payloads

steps.title: WebSocket Authorization Testing
steps.details: Test authorization controls for WebSocket operations.
steps.command: # Test unauthorized channel access and message sending

steps.title: DoS Testing
steps.details: Test for denial of service through message flooding.
steps.command: # Send large messages and rapid message bursts

steps.title: Object ID Manipulation
steps.details: Test for BOLA vulnerabilities by manipulating object IDs.
steps.command: # Modify sequential IDs, UUIDs, and hash-based IDs

steps.title: Mass Assignment Testing
steps.details: Test for mass assignment vulnerabilities in API endpoints.
steps.command: # Send additional parameters not expected by endpoint

steps.title: Business Logic Flaws
steps.details: Test for business logic vulnerabilities in API workflows.
steps.command: # Test race conditions, price manipulation, workflow bypasses

steps.title: Batch Operation Testing
steps.details: Test batch operations for authorization bypasses.
steps.command: # Test batch requests with mixed authorization contexts

stages.label: Discovery & Mapping
stages.description: Comprehensive API endpoint and service discovery
stages.command: ffuf + graphql-introspector + grpcurl for complete mapping

stages.label: Authentication Analysis
stages.description: Test JWT, OAuth, and API key authentication mechanisms
stages.command: JWT analysis + OAuth flow testing + key enumeration

stages.label: Protocol-Specific Testing
stages.description: Test GraphQL, gRPC, and WebSocket-specific vulnerabilities
stages.command: GraphQL BOLA + gRPC reflection + WebSocket injection testing

stages.label: Authorization & Business Logic
stages.description: Test BOLA, mass assignment, and business logic flaws
stages.command: Object ID manipulation + parameter injection + workflow testing

stages.label: Documentation & Reporting
stages.description: Document findings and create remediation recommendations
stages.command: Generate comprehensive API security report

stages.label: BOLA (API01) Testing
stages.description: Test for broken object property level authorization
stages.command: Object ID manipulation and unauthorized data access testing

stages.label: BFLA (API02) Testing
stages.description: Test for broken function level authorization
stages.command: Function access testing and privilege escalation attempts

stages.label: Excessive Data Exposure (API03)
stages.description: Test for excessive data exposure in API responses
stages.command: Response analysis for sensitive data leakage

stages.label: Mass Assignment (API09)
stages.description: Test for mass assignment vulnerabilities
stages.command: Parameter injection and object property testing

output_notes.meaning: Complete API schema exposed - information disclosure risk
Complete service definition exposed - reconnaissance risk
Algorithm swapping vulnerability - token forgery risk
Unauthorized data access through object manipulation
Injection vulnerabilities in WebSocket message handling

advanced_usage.title: Automated API Security Testing Pipeline
advanced_usage.command:
for api in $(cat api-targets.txt); do
  echo "Testing $api"
  ffuf -w api-wordlist.txt -u $api/FUZZ -mc 200
  curl -X POST $api/graphql -d '{"query":"{__schema{types{name}}"}'
  grpcurl -plaintext $api:50051 list
done
advanced_usage.scenario: Automated testing of multiple API endpoints
notes: Combine with authentication headers for authenticated testing

advanced_usage.title: Multi-Protocol API Testing
advanced_usage.command: # Simultaneous testing of REST, GraphQL, gRPC, and WebSocket endpoints
advanced_usage.scenario: Comprehensive API security assessment across protocols
notes: Use parallel execution for efficient testing of large API surfaces
